profileAlternative.name: Daniel Seal
profileAlternative.headline: Product Marketing Engineer at MathWorks
profileAlternative.summary:
Product Marketing Manager responsible for product marketing and product management of multiple software products. I work on projects across the spectrum of marketing, from understanding market problem to supporting the sales channel. Activities include conference attendance, market interviews, competitive analysis, use case analysis, user surveys, product naming, multi-release planning, development support, webpage management, conference presentations, webinars, seminars, workshops, sales training, and creating videos, demos, and product examples.

Technical expert with MATLAB and MATLAB-based toolboxes for algorithm development, UI development, and application deployment. This includes a strong understanding of how to use MATLAB to solve problems with big data, machine learning, statistics, optimization, image processing, computer vision, parallel computing, and connecting to hardware.

University experience with 3D CAD modeling. Internship experience with design and testing. Record of excellence in individual academic work. University specialties included Product Design, Control Theory, 3D Solid Modeling

Learn more at danjseal.com

positions.title: The MathWorks
positions.description: Lead marketing initiatives around MATLAB support for low-cost hardware, including connectivity with Arduino, Raspberri Pi, LEGO MINDSTORMS, and mobile sensors.

positions.title:
Title
Moderator
positions.description:
• Contacted professional engineers from industry, inviting them to present at our weekly colloquium lecture series
• Introduced the speaker’s background and accomplishments each week and moderated the lecture

positions.title:
Title
Research Assistant
positions.description:
• Analyzed and edited LabVIEW codes used to operate wind tunnel
• Ran wind tunnel experiments
• Identified and troubleshot problems with force balance calibration procedures

positions.title: Summer Research Intern
positions.description:
• Ran lifetime load simulations on electronic amplifiers
• Processed and reported data

positions.title: Summer Research Intern
positions.description:
• Wired, calibrated, and tested pressure transducers, dissolved oxygen sensor, flow meter, Bessel filters, digital thermometer, and PID control valve on multiple DAQ systems for use in a cavitation experiment
• Generated LabVIEW VIs and Sub-VIs to operate these instrumentation systems

positions.title: Summer Intern
positions.description: • Developed and presented a project describing telecommunications and radio science at an introductory level
